project_abstract.cdata: The Second Highway Project, which is intended to strengthen highway administration, to provide the means to carry out road maintenance and to execute road rehabilitation, consists of: (a) providing to the Bureau of Roads experts to fill senior positions in the Bureau and to train personnel; (b) purchases of road-maintenance and other equipment required in the Bureau's operations, and training operators and mechanics for such equipment; (c) the rehabilitation of about 1,900 km. of high priority roads; (d) feasibility studies of about 600 km. of roads and detailed engineering of about 400 km. of roads; and (e) strengthening the National Highway Laboratory by the provision of technical assistance and equipment.
